message.content:
cs.AI, cs.GR, cs.HC, cs.DB, cs.CL. 

The paper discusses a system that generates murder mystery adventures using open data as source content. This involves the use of generative algorithms to transform linked data into different game objects. Therefore, the paper is likely to belong to the following arXiv CS sub-categories: 

- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): The generative algorithms used in the system are likely to involve AI techniques such as natural language processing, machine learning, and knowledge representation. 
- cs.GR (Graphics): The paper may discuss the visual design and presentation of the game, including the user interface and the rendering of game objects. 
- cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction): The paper may discuss the user experience of playing the game, including the ease of use of the interface and the engagement of the gameplay. 
- cs.DB (Databases): The paper may discuss the use of open data as source content for the game, including the data acquisition, processing, and integration. 
- cs.CL (Computation and Language): The paper may discuss the natural language generation and understanding aspects of the generative algorithms used in the system.
